MajorClaims.MC1: freedom of expressing thoughts and ideas should always be eulogized and it's rather iniquitous to impose a shackle on artists' will to create
MajorClaims.MC2: they should be encouraged to express their innovative ideas

Claims.C1: this world needs them to make itself colourful
Claims.C2: One of the major concerns against freeing artists' creation derives from the fear of social misleading which would destabilize the society
Claims.C3: restrictions on exposure to adolescents should apply

Premises.P1: the audiences have their own judgement and are not likely to be misled or influenced by some art work
Premises.P2: art inevitably involves imagination, exaggeration and sometimes is purely fabricated; regardless of whether the work of art is based on truth or not, it is the public's authority to determine how to interpret its meaning
Premises.P3: If the art displays unreality, the public audiences certainly have the acumen to recognise its untruthfulness and only appreciate its art value
Premises.P4: the notion of being afraid of social misleading is unjustified
Premises.P5: some of the art work may contain negative implications such as insanity, violence, eroticism etc
Premises.P6: adolescents are not mature enough to avoid being led astray by these contents
Premises.P7: in the case of adults being the audience, there's really nothing to hide – these negative things objectively exist on this planet and it is impossible for adults to be brain-washed only because of some pieces of creative art
